CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 16, 1960, pg. 5 reads: "Women Endorse Mrs. Kirk - Officers and members of the FDR Women's Democratic Social Club of the 13th Ward went on record last Sunday with endorsement of Mrs. Sarah Kirk for ward chairman, along with her entire slate. This action came in the home of Mrs. Georgia Paylor of 7334 Idlewild St.  Officers of the FDR Women's club are, left to right, seated: Mrs. Mary White, financial secretary; Mrs. Natalie Moyer, president, and Mrs. Lillian Turner.  Standing: Mrs. Ruth Cartledge, corresponding secretary; Mrs. Maria Miles, Mrs. Georgia Paylor, past president, and Mrs. Sarah Kirk, alderman and chairman of the 13th Ward. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of FDR Women's Club officers, from left, seated: Mary White, Natalie Moyer, and Lillian Turner; standing: Ruth Cartledge, Maria Miles, and Georgia Paylor, with club's endorsed candidate Alderman Sarah Kirk, gathered around table in home of Georgia Paylor, 7334 Idlewild Street
